title.value: O NLINE BLACK - BOX ADAPTATION TO LABEL - SHIFT IN THE PRESENCE OF CONDITIONAL - SHIFT
title.justification: The title 'O NLINE BLACK - BOX ADAPTATION TO LABEL - SHIFT IN THE PRESENCE OF CONDITIONAL - SHIFT' represents the main focus of the research which is adaptation of predictive models in the presence of label and conditional shifts.
title.quote: O NLINE BLACK - BOX ADAPTATION TO LABEL - SHIFT IN THE PRESENCE OF CONDITIONAL - SHIFT

extractions.description: This paper explores empirical methods for online adaptation of predictive models to label shifts while considering the presence of concurrent conditional shifts. It evaluates the performance of such methods on synthetic and realistic datasets for both classification and regression problems. The paper presents improved performance by learning additional hyper-parameters using appropriate validation sets.

type.justification: The paper reports empirical findings from experiments conducted to evaluate the effectiveness of online adaptation methods for label and conditional shifts.
type.quote: In this paper, we empirically explore the effectiveness of online adaptation methods in such situations on three synthetic and two realistic datasets, comprising both classification and regression problems.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on domain adaptation techniques, specifically for handling label and conditional shifts in unsupervised settings.
name.quote: We consider an out-of-distribution setting where trained predictive models are deployed online in new locations (inducing conditional-shift), such that these locations are also associated with differently skewed target distributions (label-shift).

name.justification: The models and methods discussed are deployed and adapted online in real-time to changing data distributions.
name.quote: We consider a setting where we have black-box access to a predictive model which we are interested in deploying online in different places with skewed label distributions.

name.justification: The empirical study is conducted on datasets involving classification problems.
name.quote: In this paper, we empirically explore the effectiveness of online adaptation methods in such situations on three synthetic and two realistic datasets, comprising both classification and regression problems.

name.justification: The empirical study also encompasses regression problems, showing the general applicability of the methods.
name.quote: We empirically explore such methods when the underlying assumption of an invariant conditional distribution is broken. Such situations are likely to arise in reality...enabling us to develop an analogous baseline for online adaptation in regression problems.

name.justification: The ResNet-50 model is used for evaluation in the empirical study, specifically for realistic datasets.
name.quote: We train a ResNet-50 for 400 epochs with SGD+Momentum for the underlying model, achieving an in-distribution test accuracy of âˆ¼ 75%.

is_contributed.justification: The model was not introduced as a new contribution by the paper but was used for experiments.
is_contributed.quote: We train a ResNet-50 for 400 epochs with SGD+Momentum for the underlying model...

is_executed.justification: The model was executed in the experiments conducted in the paper, demonstrating its performance under different conditions.
is_executed.quote: We train a ResNet-50 for 400 epochs with SGD+Momentum for the underlying model...

is_compared.justification: The performance of the ResNet-50 model was compared with other models and methods discussed in the paper.
is_compared.quote: We compare variants of online label-shift methods based on our discussion above on a mix of synthetic and realistic datasets to the un-adjusted model performance (BASE).

referenced_paper_title.value: Microsoft coco: Common objects in context
referenced_paper_title.justification: This referenced paper discusses MS-COCO dataset which is used in conjunction with the ResNet-50 model.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We construct a second, more photo-realistic, synthetic dataset by superimposing segmented objects from COCO Lin et al. (2014) on to scenes from the P LACES dataset Zhou et al. (2017), as in Ahmed et al. (2021).

name.justification: The MS-COCO dataset is used to create synthetic datasets for the empirical study.
name.quote: We construct a second, more photo-realistic, synthetic dataset by superimposing segmented objects from COCO Lin et al. (2014) on to scenes from the P LACES dataset Zhou et al. (2017), as in Ahmed et al. (2021).

referenced_paper_title.value: Microsoft coco: Common objects in context
referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the referenced paper which describes the MS-COCO dataset.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We construct a second, more photo-realistic, synthetic dataset by superimposing segmented objects from COCO Lin et al. (2014)

name.justification: The WILDS-IWildCam dataset is used to evaluate the performance of the online adaptation methods.
name.quote: We use the variant of the I W ILD C AM 2020 dataset Beery et al. (2021) curated by the WILDS set of benchmarks for out-of-distribution (OOD) generalization Koh et al. (2021).

referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the referenced paper which describes the WILDS-IWildCam dataset.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We use the variant of the I W ILD C AM 2020 dataset Beery et al. (2021)

name.justification: The MNIST dataset is used as part of the synthetic datasets to evaluate online adaptation methods.
name.quote: We split MNIST classes into two subsets: [0, 1, 2, 5, 9] and [3, 4, 6, 7, 8].

referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the referenced paper which describes the MNIST dataset.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We split MNIST classes into two subsets: [0, 1, 2, 5, 9] and [3, 4, 6, 7, 8].

name.justification: The SGD library is used as part of the optimization process for training models in the study.
name.quote: We train a ResNet-50 for 400 epochs with SGD+Momentum for the underlying model...

referenced_paper_title.justification: This paper is likely to provide a reference on the usage and application of SGD in training large scale distributed deep networks.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We train a ResNet-50 for 400 epochs with SGD+Momentum for the underlying model...

name.justification: Batch normalization is used in the process of training certain neural network models for the study.
name.quote: The network architecture consists of 3 CONV layers with 64, 128 and 256 channels, each followed by MAXPOOL, BATCHNORM, and RELU.

referenced_paper_title.value: Batch Normalization: Accelerating Deep Network Training by Reducing Internal Covariate Shift
referenced_paper_title.justification: This paper is a relevant source that discusses the batch normalization technique, which is used within the experimental setup of the study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The network architecture consists of 3 CONV layers with 64, 128 and 256 channels, each followed by MAXPOOL, BATCHNORM, and RELU.
